p: p22, also called p20 (NS4), when excised from the polyprotein by the viral protease, results in a mature NS protein of 20–22 kDa, depending on the genogroup ( 36, 61). The evolutionary rate of the genomic region that encodes the p22 protein of the strain GII.P4 Den Haag 2006b of HuNoV is ~8.21 × 10 −3 substitutions/site/year, which is higher than the evolutionary rate determined for the complete genome, being one of the most variable genomic regions of this strain ( 54).
